name: Kempinski Hotel Airport Munchen

reviews.text: There is just nothing special about this place. The location is convenient if you fly in/out of Munich (not if you plan to visit the city) as it as a short walk only to terminal 2. Check in was quick and friendly.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and the room are very hold with no athosphere. Bar and restaurant were deserted. Rooms are not stylish or cosy - just modern/functional.
reviews.title: Refreshingly delightful airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price is too high ($300 plus breakfast) and Internet is extra at the ridiculous charge of €6 per hour - not acceptable for a business hotel.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Forget all about dull and worn down airport hotels - Kempinsky Hotel Airport München is a cut above the traditional hotels at most busy airports. Easy to reach with three minutes walk from the two airport terminals, very comfortable guest rooms, quick check-in and express check-out, for ever smiling staffmembers, really good bar serving traditional German snacks. And a fantastic
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast buffet. Only problem would be that you normally do not have the time to savour everything that is offered on the buffet. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel at the Airport

reviews.text: We had a "day stay" at this hotel between flights.
reviews.title: Excellent choice between flights

reviews.text: We booked the hotel through their online booking service. The booking staff was very prompt in answering to all our questions and requests.
reviews.title: Stubbed toes

reviews.text: The room was very nice, clean, sound proof, with a large bathroom having all the needed toiletries. They provided us with a baby cot. Staff very helpful and polite.
reviews.title: Good hotel if you are in transit for a night , soft mattress not good
Make it "Easy on Yourself"!
reviews.text: The lobby is gorgeous, stuff professional, breakfast wonderful, including freshly squeezed juices. However, do not book a twin room! It seems that most, if not all twin rooms are spaces that if need be get converted to conference rooms, so beds are the murphy-bed type that open up for the night. There are several drawbacks here: 1) the worst one is that the sharp metal feet of the murphy-bed extend further than the bed itself, resulting in stubbed toes - three times! 2) there is a huge hole between the top of the bed and the wall, so you really have no support and the pillow keep sliding into the hole. 3) when you lie down on the bed, your head and shoulders seem to be inside the closet, a strange feeling indeed, 4) most of the closets in the room are key-locked, probably to keep the supplies, but it feels strange to be there, like sleeping in the office.

We ended up spending 75E to upgrade to a suite and were very happy with it, even though it was pricey. However, other people in our group stayed in the standard twin rooms, which resulted in more stubbed toes.
reviews.title: A Crystal Palace of a hotel right by T2

reviews.text: Rooms amazingly quiet. Service eager. Food very good in the courtyard. Just a first class experience overall. You can absolutely not hear anything in these rooms, airplanes, adjoining rooms, hallway chatter ... nothing. Beds comfortable. Room size is good. Wi-fi is free but a real pain. Every time you open the browser you have to log in all over again. The signal was too low in the room for a connection. Bad news for a business oriented modern hotel.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ALERT: Book and pay for the rooms online and you have a 90% cancellation fee. In other words there are no refunds once you have booked. For another stay we booked two months ahead, had to change one month ahead but they could not accommodate because they were all booked. So we had to cancel with a 90% cancellation fee one full month ahead with them being fully booked. Rip-off. I hope they are proud.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

reviews.text: We were put up at the Kempinski by Audi, prior to picking up our car via their European delivery program. After long flights and delays coming from the U.S., it was so nice to pick up our luggage and make the short walk to the hotel. The common areas are very spacious and pleasant. The room was extremely quiet and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was great. Would definitely stay there again if I needed to be near the airport.
reviews.title: The best one I have ever been

reviews.text: Hotel Kempinski Munich airport is only a few steps from terminal 1 and 2 (just in between).
reviews.title: Germanic efficiency

reviews.text: It was so perfect, that I have nothing to add. The best of many hundreds hotels I have visited!
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite a grand place, and the prices reflect this. The rooms are elegant and the staff very friendly and professional. The hotel is located within a block or so of the Munich Airport. One can also catch public transportation to downtown Munich and be there in a half hour or so. We wound up staying at the hotel when the continuation of our flight was cancelled.
reviews.title: Kempinski Hotel Airport

reviews.text: You will hardly find any hotel closer to an airport than the Kempinsiki at MUC. A 2 minutes walk and you'll be greeted very friendly. The open architecture invites you to stay a the bar for a drink and if you are just there for a stop over you won't miss the city (which is far, far away...). Rooms are spacious and clean and you won't hear much noise from the airplanes. Roomservice was very good and on time. Prices are elevated but not a ripp-off.
reviews.title: Best airport hotel

reviews.text: My Lufthansa flight to Tbilisi Georgia was canceled. Lufthansa put us up in the Kempinski airport hotel for the night (and it was quite late) and also provided dinner and breakfast. The hotel was very nice. Staff was awesome. The restaurant/bar was really cool. I had Asian finger food (shrimp rolls, dimsum, chicken sticks, etc. with 3 sauces. Unexpectedly good. As I have found in many European restaurants, getting a second drink and the check is a slow process. All in all an unexpected pleasure.
reviews.title: An unexpected pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you get over the rather bavarian taste layout of the lobby with palm trees and audi cars (matter of personal tastes, which this is not mine, however I understood the concept of bavaria meets hollywood) you can´t go wrong. All finally right: silent, comfortable, no cheap eye candy, great beds, great air quality, despite the size and amount of glass feels quite personal, intimate and warm (!), great spa, great breakfast (spend some time there), great mints if you ask for them at the reception. If you can afford this hotel, have been around and can appreciate real solid value (not for money, it´s expencive, but in quality) stay here. Definitely one of the best hotels in Munich.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: This really felt like a luxurious hotel, though I got a very good price last minute and I have often seen good late deals for this hotel. It's very handy for the airport but be warned that the airport is quite a long way from the town - so this is a great base for an early flight but no use for sightseeing.
reviews.title: surprisingly good value

description: Kempinski Hotel Airport Munich is located between Terminal 1 and 2 at the Munich Airport, just a few steps beyond customs and 35km north-east from Munich city centre.The four-story and transparent hotel was built in 1994 and set in the futuristic landscape of Munich Airport. The center structure marks a 1,400 sqm glass atrium with 20 tropical palm trees. The 389 rooms and suites are equipped with functionally amenities such as sound-proof windows, black curtains, a relaxing chair and working desk.The fit & fly SPA including indoor pool, sauna, steam bath, gym as well as SPA treatments offers the guest a perfect location for refreshment and relaxing.At the elegant restaurant charles lindbergh they offer regional cuisine and regular theme buffets from Friday to Sunday for up to 200 persons. Or relax at our Nightflight Bar with fantastic drinks and snacks.
